column5: Well, since its been a almost 8 months I havent been around, I though i show you the biggest surprise we caught lat year fishing for walleye  We all remember my sturgeon I caught a couple of years ago    Well, heres the surprise we caught   Another 65 pounds Sturgeon on 8lb test and it took over 2 hrs to land and 1/2 tank of gas  Just so you guys now WE ATE THEM BOTH   Ok, No we didnt, I NEVER keep any of my sturgeon we catch.Its all catch and release!!!  Hope I remember how to host pics(lol)
That's a heckuva fish for 8 lb. test!!! Good on ya for the C&R!!!
It's real good to have you back posting here again Dan, you were missed fer sure, and it's also good to see your still tangling with those brutes !!  Awesome fish bud !!
Thanks Guys.  Randy, we actually caught this bad boy on Mattagamie river, the river that runs threw town  But normally when I target them, its on the Groundhog River
LOL Dan had to look that one up, empties into the James bay? water runs up hill? Nice fish! Nice release!
All I can say Dan is GO HAB GO !! good to have you back.
Had that discussion before have ya??  Nice fish there Dan.
great looking fish, thanks for sharing with us! Also good to hear about the C&R!
Awesome Brother!!!  Hope you and Rocky are doing well!!!!  Tell him I said HEY!!!   Chrispy!

SWEEEEET.  Gotta love those incidental sturgies!  Caught mine on the Blanche river a coupla years back.  Same scenario, xept we were fishing from shore ahaahh.  Noice one Dan.  CnR forever.  cheers HD
GREAT to see your back Dan.  A couple of very impressive fish.
Nice fish, DTM!!  Are you gonna be around this spring on Round Lake?????

You guys talking about the Blanche and Round near Kirkland Lake?  I really miss it up there.  My father grew up in Chaput Hughes and I spent most of my summer vacations in that area for about 20 years.  Fished all around there.  Put thousands of miles on the 12ft aluminum car topper on all of the lakes and rivers.  Nice part of the world.  Since my grandmother passed a few years ago I haven't been back.
